text: Einar Osland (17 December 1886 - 16 February 1955) was a Norwegian politician for the Liberal Party. He was born in Lavik og Brekke. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from the Market towns of Vest-Agder and Rogaland in 1950, but was not re-elected in 1954. He had previously served in the position of deputy representative during the term 1945-1930 and 1949. Osland held various positions in Haugesund city council from 1925 to 1955, except for a period between 1940 and 1945 during the German occupation of Norway. He served as deputy mayor in 1931-1934 and mayor in 1947-1949\. ==References== * Category:1886 births Category:1955 deaths Category:Liberal Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Einar Osland
